related_questions.question: What are some problems of solar energy?
related_questions.snippet: The sun offers the most abundant, reliable and pollution-free power in the world. However, problems with solar energy, namely the expensive cost and inconsistent availability, have prevented it from becoming a more utilized energy source.
related_questions.title: Problems With Solar Energy - Solar Power

related_questions.question: Why solar panels are bad?
related_questions.snippet: While solar panels are considered a form of clean, renewable energy, the manufacturing process does produce greenhouse gas emissions. Additionally, to produce solar panels, manufacturers need to handle toxic chemicals. However, solar panels are not emitting toxins into the atmosphere as they're generating electricity.Feb 1, 2018

related_questions.question: Why is solar energy not reliable?
related_questions.snippet: Solar power is not physically reliable because it is inconsistent, inefficient, and cannot meet electricity demand. ... Because it is inconsistent, solar energy depends on more reliable sources of energy for backup such as coal and natural gas.

organic_results.title: Problems With Solar Energy - Solar Power
organic_results.snippet: The main problem with solar power that has stifled its use is the fact that energy production only takes place when the sun is shining.
